title: External cardinal
data: Pope Innocent III refused to confirm the election
Cardinal-deacon of S. Maria in Via Lata 1182-1193 , cardinal-priest of S. Prassede 1193-1210
In the letter issued in November/December 1201 Pope Innocent III rejected this election In 1203 he acted for a short time as patriarch-elect of Jerusalem ( see table above )
Cardinal-deacon of S. Lucia in Septisolio 1206/07-1211 , cardinal-priest of S. Cecilia 1211-1213 , cardinal-bishop of Albano 1213-1230
Pope Honorius III refused to confirm his election and on April 25 , 1219 appointed Pietro Capuano ( future cardinal ) to the vacated patriarchal see
Cardinal- deacon of S. Eustachio 1216-1219 , cardinal-priest of S. Susanna 1219-1221 , cardinal-bishop of Sabina 1221-1223
Honorius III in the letter issued on December 4 , 1219 informed the cathedral chapter of Paris that he had refused to confirm this election and that the chapter should elect a new candidate
Cardinal-bishop of Porto e Santa Rufina 1219 - 1227
Pope Honorius III rejected his election
Cardinal-deacon of S. Maria in Via Lata 1216 , cardinal-priest of S. Sabina 1216 - 1239
Pope Gregory IX rejected his election

On May 14 , 1240 Pope Gregory IX appointed new patriarch and in the letter of his nomination explained the canons of the chapter of Jerusalem the reasons of his earlier rejection of the election of Cardinal de Vitry , who had died on May 1 , 1240
On February 21 , 1248 Pope Innocent IV rejected his postulation to that see and appointed Juan de Medina Pomar as new archbishop of Toledo
Cardinal-priest of S. Marcello 1244 - 1252 , cardinal-bishop of Sabina 1251/52 - 1253
Pope Innocent IV refused to confirm his election indicating that his presence in curia is indispensable
section_title: Rejected episcopal elections of the cardinals in 13th century
